reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Bjork for seven nights over the Easter holidays and would have no hesitation recommending this hotel. Don't be put off by the outside appearance which looks very plain. When booking we had requested a room at the front of the hotel and although it was late at night and dark when we arrived we awoke in the morning to a lovely view of the sea and the snow - capped mountains beyond. Our room, although not huge, was simply furnished and spotlessly clean as was the en-suite. Tea and coffee making facilities were also provided. It was also lovely and warm. There was a good selection at the buffet breakfast. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. We had to check out at 5am on the day we were leaving due to an early flight and the hotel provided us with tea and coffee before we left and sandwiches to take with us which was greatly appreciated. The Flybus also collected us right outside the hotel which was great. The only criticism we would have is that on the website for the hotel it states that it is only a few minutes walk to the centre of town when in fact it takes about 15 minutes. This did not really worry us but some people might prefer to stay closer to the centre. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Bjork again - it was very pleasant and excellent value for the reasonable price that we paid.
reviews.title: A very pleasant hotel at a reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful....toilet not working in our room on arrival and we were immediately given another room (room 203) - nice and large and clean and tidy - breakfast was continental but with plenty of choice...cereals, toast, bread, cheese, ham, yogart, tomatoes, fresh orange juice, tea and coffee. We had booked our Blue Lagoon trip from the Uk and the receptionist sorted our pick up time. He also gave us directions for food (Ruby Tuesday very nice and just over the road) - although not central only minutes away from main street and onto the rest of the city centre.....had a lovely stay at the Bjork and would recommend. Thanks XX
reviews.title: Clean - tidy - large room with friendly staff
A little corker!
reviews.text: Having just returned from an eight day stay in Iceland I would highly recommend this hotel. It isn't swanky or glamorous, but has all the basics you require and is pretty modern and clean; with the added bonus of very comfy beds. You get tea and coffee in the rooms, a nice (yet small) bathroom and a superb breakfast...bread, eggs, cheese, cold meats, melon, cereal etc...all very fresh and cheerful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff are very helpful and didn't raise a disapproving eyebrow when we stumbled in (quietly!) at six in the morning! Yet I don't want to make it sound like a party hotel...it was rather quiet and had a mix of families and young couples/friends.
reviews.title: Solid Hotel - good, but nothing special

reviews.text: It is a little trek to downtown (Laugaveger area) but it's not too bad as to put you off (around 10 minutes to the start of the nightlife and restaurants)
reviews.title: perfect place to stay in iceland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While staying in Reykjavik we stayed one night in the 4th Street Hotel right downtown and then another 5 nights at Hotel Bjork. Both had a very friendly staff. Both hotels had a very nice breakfast bar in the restaurants attached to the hotels (the restaurants open an hour early so that hotel guest can get breakfast before opening to the general public). The breakfast bar was better at 4th St. Hotel and it had a small bar/lounging area for guest, it was a tad more “trendy” but it had much smaller rooms with sound issues. Hotel Bjork had spacious rooms, free internet access in the lobby, (which was a must for me) and the restaurant connected to the hotel was nice, yet (comparatively) reasonably priced and great for dinners or a quick drink. I thought the Bjork location was great – just a couple of blocks from city center so there was not a sound issue, but close enough that I could wear heals and walk to the downtown area with no problem. Again, great staff, that answered all my questions about day tours and day tour hotel pick-ups. I would have no problem to again stay there.
reviews.title: You will have no problems if you book this hotel

reviews.text: It is good value for this class of hotel. 15-20 mins from city centre, bus stop 2 mins walk away. Staff are helpful and there is internet at lobby. Breakfast is cold buffet, simple but sufficient. Can't complain about this hotel, nothing to yell about, but practical. The restaurant Potturinn og Pannan (Pots and Pan), serves good food. Even the tour guide recommends it.
reviews.title: Comfortable and compact

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel to stay. First I got a room with view to the yard but next day I was able to change the room and got one with view to ocean instead. City center ~ 10 min walk.
reviews.title: very good hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suggest to walk to open-air pools, it costs approx. 5 euros. (walking distance ~15min, ask for the directions at the reception)
reviews.title: Don't use centralr.com to book your stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a week's stay in Hotel Bjork, in Reykjavik, Iceland, in January. I used the hotel website, and when payment was taken I was transferred to centralr.com. The total price quoted was €381, broken down to the price of the room per night. The price in Euros was in bold typeface, with the price in Kronur in small typeface beneath. There was nothing to say that €381 was an approximate price, and no link through to an independent currency conversion website, so I took it that this was the correct amount.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: I travelled to Reykjavik with my sister and we had a twin room. The rooms were cosy, had enough for a short break and the comfiest beds ever! Bathroom was fine too, and the breakfast was ample and filling.
reviews.title: A nice quiet place to stay

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant twice after coming back from trips being very tired. We really enjoyed the food, especially the lamb steaks.
reviews.title: Comfy and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception was friendly enough and helped us outwith booking tours/airport shuttle etc.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel

reviews.text: The only negative was the distance to town. It was fine when the weather was warmer, but being tired we found we could not always face the hike to the centre. It does take about 10min to the edge of the centre, but to most of the bars and restaurants its at least 15-20 minutes.
reviews.title: Great economical place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a really nice stay and I would probably stay here again despite it being out of town!
reviews.title: Friendly, informative staff

reviews.text: I stayed at the Bjork with my best mate for 4 nights in early September. Our visit was a "lads" trip to see the sights of Reykjavik and Iceland (although both of us "lads" are 50!). The reviews of the Bjork had been quite promising but to be honest I was a little disappoointed. The hotel is located amid commercial/light industrial buildings on the periphery of inner Reykjavik and the immediate environment is a little seedy-ish and unlovely...perfectly safe though and quiet at night. The short walk to the action of Laugevagur is nothing like the 15 to 20 minutes claimed by other reviewers - more like 10 at most. (Unless they have very short legs!).
reviews.title: Good location - functional rather than anything else

reviews.text: Our twin bedded room was pretty small with a shower but no bath - it was scrupulously clean though and although the weather was much milder than we expected the hotel was also very comfortably warm. All in all, no complaints as such about the Bjork other than if we'd known it was this basic we'd have opted for somewhere a little more comfortable. Incidentally, on our second night there we dined in the hotel restaurant the "pots and pans" - talk about chalk and cheese - the food itself was absolutely super; the service was an unpalatable cocktail of chaos and indifference, none more so than the cheerless blonde lady who was seemingly the maitre d - she clearly longed to be somewhere else. Eventually, so did we.
reviews.title: Great time in Iceland
5 night break in Reykjavik
reviews.text: Reykjavik itself and Iceland generally are utterly fantastic - do visit - but think hard before you opt for the Bjork.

For me the most important thing was the service provided by the Staff at the Hotel. They were friendly and helpful and would go that extra step to make sure your questions were answered or a sevice provided. Being a solo traveller this was particularly helpful. The room was single and overlooked the back of the hotel. It was basic but served my needs. Tea and coffee was provided. The hotel was located further out of the centre of Reykjavik than I had anticpated but this was not an insurmoutable problem. This did mean that it was in a quiet location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from 5 night trip to Reykjavik. The Iceland air flight was excellent with much needed leg room for tall people and a screen with movies, games etc (remember to take headphones or buy them for 3 euros). We stayed in Hotel Bjork which looked quite ugly from outside but was fine inside with an excellent restaurant. We found Reykjavik itself to be disappointing - and would not wish to spend a weekend here but we used it as a base and went on 3 trips which were fantastic. the Golden Circle tour, South Coast trip and the Snaefellsness Peninsular. The scenery on each tour was breathtaking: geysers, waterfalls to walk behind, craters, mudpools, black sand beaches and the glacier - the landscape here was as i imagine the moon to be. We booked with Iceland Horizon although the minibuses and guide turned up from go Travel so I thinjk they share trips - everyone speaks fluent English, the £ is much stronger now as 1000ISK is equivalent now to about £4.80. All in all we had a fantastic time, got loads of great photos, weather was like England spring but I would say for the whale watching it is essential to wear hat to cover ears and gloves and rainmac as very cold and windy. I love Iceland, I want to go back!
reviews.title: Great view
